dialog.line: So Steve, trouble on the bus I hear?
Yes Miss. I know Rachel and Luke told you, but there's nothing you can do.
Well I can listen to what you say about it Steve. Have you told your parents about it?

I dunno really. It just seems like something you have to put up with don't you. If they get involved it will just make things worse, and the school can't do anything about what a kid from another school says to me on the bus.
Perhaps the head could speak to the girl's head, and get it stopped.
They wouldn't bother though would they. I mean, it's only a bit of name-calling... Anyway, it might make it worse.
But it's making you really miserable, and you try to get different buses Rachel said, and sometimes you walk home, which you're not supposed to...
I just hope she gets fed up with her game and stops.
So you just think there's nothing anyone can do to stop it. You know who she is don't you?
Can we both think about things we could try? I know you feel a bit helpless but honestly you don't have to put up with it. How long has it been going on by the way?

That's months! Okay, we could contact her school and they might speak to her individually or they might do a general thing about name-calling. We could contact the community policeman, who might tell her what she's doing is against the law. Maybe her parents could be told - you don't know, they might not like what she's doing.
Just think about it Steve. I'm not going to do anything until we talk again, but you should not have to put up with this bullying.
